Container.Name: medusa
Container.Overview: Medusa(https://pymedusa.com/) is an automatic Video Library Manager for TV Shows. It watches for new episodes of your favorite shows, and when they are posted it does its magic.
Container.Changes:
### 2025-03-02 - Rebase to Alpine 3.21.
### 2024-01-08 - Rebase to Alpine 3.19.
### 2023-10-07 - Install unrar from linuxserver repo(https://github.com/linuxserver/docker-unrar).
### 2023-08-10 - Bump unrar to 6.2.10.
### 2023-07-11 - Rebase to Alpine 3.18.
### 2023-07-06 - Deprecate armhf. As announced here(https://www.linuxserver.io/blog/a-farewell-to-arm-hf)
### 2023-02-13 - Rebase to Alpine 3.17, migrate to s6v3.
### 2022-09-12 - Install ffmpeg for postprocessing.
### 2022-08-12 - Bump unrar to 6.1.7.
### 2022-02-28 - Install python3 requirements for app.
### 2022-01-19 - Rebasing to alpine 3.15.
### 2020-06-01 - Rebasing to alpine 3.12.
### 2019-12-19 - Rebasing to alpine 3.11.
### 2019-09-22 - Switch to python3.
### 2019-06-28 - Rebasing to alpine 3.10.
### 2019-03-23 - Switching to new Base images, shift to arm32v7 tag.
### 2019-02-22 - Rebasing to alpine 3.9.
### 2019-01-14 - Adding multi arch and pipeline logic
### 2018-08-16 - Rebase to alpine 3.8
### 2017-12-08 - Rebase to alpine 3.7
### 2017-11-29 - Add py-gdbm for subtitles support
### 2017-10-26 - Mediainfo moved from testing to community repo
### 2017-10-10 - Use repo version of mediainfo to shorten build time
### 2017-08-05 - Internal git pull instead of at runtime
### 2017-05-25 - Rebase to alpine 3.6
### 2017-02-07 - Rebase to alpine 3.5
### 2017-01-02 - Initial Release

Config.Name: WebUI
Config.Description: The port for the Medusa webui
